metadata.title: CVE-2024-27280 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer-overread issue was discovered in StringIO 3.0.1, as distributed inRuby 3.0.x through 3.0.6 and 3.1.x through 3.1.4. The ungetbyte and ungetcmethods on a StringIO can read past the end of a string, and a subsequentcall to StringIO.gets may return the memory value. 3.0.3 is the main fixedversion; however, for Ruby 3.0 users, a fixed version is stringio 3.0.1.1,and for Ruby 3.1 users, a fixed version is stringio 3.0.1.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27280` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby3.2 - 3.2.3-1build3
ruby3.2 - 3.2.3-1build3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby3.2 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-1build3').
jruby package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
